theorem mem_pos_tangent_cone_at_of_segment_subset {s : set E} {x y : E} (h : segment (expr‚Ñù) x y ‚äÜ s) :
    y - x ‚àà pos_tangent_cone_at s x := by
  let c := fun n : ‚Ñï => (2 : expr‚Ñù) ^ n

  show x + d n ‚àà segment (expr‚Ñù) x y
  ¬∑ rw [segment_eq_image']
    refine' ‚ü®(c n)‚Åª¬π, ‚ü®_, _‚ü©, rfl‚ü©
    exacts[inv_nonneg.2 (pow_nonneg zero_le_two _), inv_le_one (one_le_pow_of_one_le one_le_two _)]
  show tendsto (fun n => ¬´expr ‚Ä¢ ¬ª (c n) (d n)) at_top ((nhds) (y - x))
  ¬∑ convert tendsto_const_nhds
    ext n

/-- If `f` has a local max on `s` at `a`, `f'` is the derivative of `f` at `a` within `s`, and

    (hf : has_fderiv_within_at f f' s a) {y} (hy : y ‚àà pos_tangent_cone_at s a) : f' y ‚â§ 0 :=
  by

  refine' le_of_tendsto (hf.lim at_top hd hc' hcd) _

  exact tendsto_inf.2 ‚ü®tendsto_const_nhds.add (tangent_cone_at.lim_zero _ hc' hcd), by rwa [tendsto_principal]‚ü©
  rw [add_zero] at hd

      (f (a + d n) ‚â§ f a)
  exact mem_map.1 (hd h)
  replace hc :
    ¬´expr‚àÄ·∂† in , ¬ª "./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:210:13: unsupported notation `¬´expr‚àÄ·∂† in , ¬ª" at_top
      (0 ‚â§ c n)
  exact mem_map.1 (hc (mem_at_top (0 : expr‚Ñù)))
  filter_upwards [h, hc]
  simp only [smul_eq_mul, mem_preimage, subset_def]
  intro n hnf hn
  exact mul_nonpos_of_nonneg_of_nonpos hn (sub_nonpos.2 hnf)
#align is_local_max_on.has_fderiv_within_at_nonpos is_local_max_on.has_fderiv_within_at_nonpos

/-- If `f` has a local min on `s` at `a`, `f'` is the derivative of `f` at `a` within `s`, and
`y` belongs to the positive tangent cone of `s` at `a`, then `0 ‚â§ f' y`. -/

    (hf : has_fderiv_within_at f f' s a) {y} (hy : y ‚àà pos_tangent_cone_at s a) : 0 ‚â§ f' y := by

/-- If `f` has a local max on `s` at `a`, `f'` is a derivative of `f` at `a` within `s`, and
both `y` and `-y` belong to the positive tangent cone of `s` at `a`, then `f' y ‚â§ 0`. -/
theorem is_local_min_on.has_fderiv_within_at_eq_zero {s : set E} (h : is_local_min_on f s a)

    f' y = 0 := by simpa using h.neg.has_fderiv_within_at_eq_zero hf.neg hy hy'

/-- **Fermat's Theorem**: the derivative of a function at a local extremum equals zero. -/
theorem is_local_extr.has_fderiv_at_eq_zero (h : is_local_extr f a) : has_fderiv_at f f' a ‚Üí f' = 0 :=
  h.elim is_local_min.has_fderiv_at_eq_zero is_local_max.has_fderiv_at_eq_zero
#align is_local_extr.has_fderiv_at_eq_zero is_local_extr.has_fderiv_at_eq_zero

/-- **Fermat's Theorem**: the derivative of a function at a local extremum equals zero. -/
theorem is_local_extr.fderiv_eq_zero (h : is_local_extr f a) : fderiv (expr‚Ñù) f a = 0 :=

exists_local_extr_Ioo:
/-- A continuous function on a closed interval with `f a = f b` has a local extremum at some
point of the corresponding open interval. -/
theorem exists_local_extr_Ioo (hab : a < b) (hfc : continuous_on f (Icc a b)) (hfI : f a = f b) :
    ‚àÉ c ‚àà Ioo a b, is_local_extr f c :=
  let ‚ü®c, cmem, hc‚ü© := exists_Ioo_extr_on_Icc f hab hfc hfI
  ‚ü®c, cmem, hc.is_local_extr <| Icc_mem_nhds cmem.1 cmem.2‚ü©
#align exists_local_extr_Ioo exists_local_extr_Ioo
exists_has_deriv_at_eq_zero':
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within.gt -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within.lt -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/-- **Rolle's Theorem**, a version for a function on an open interval: if `f` has derivative `f'`
on `(a, b)` and has the same limit `l` at `ùìù[>] a` and `ùìù[<] b`, then `f' c = 0`
for some `c ‚àà (a, b)`.  -/
theorem exists_has_deriv_at_eq_zero' (hab : a < b) (hfa : tendsto f (nhds_within.gt a) ((nhds) l))
    (hfb : tendsto f (nhds_within.lt b) ((nhds) l)) (hff' : ‚àÄ x ‚àà Ioo a b, has_deriv_at f (f' x) x) :
    ‚àÉ c ‚àà Ioo a b, f' c = 0 :=
  by
  have : continuous_on f (Ioo a b) := fun x hx => (hff' x hx).continuous_at.continuous_within_at
  have hcont := continuous_on_Icc_extend_from_Ioo hab.ne this hfa hfb
  obtain ‚ü®c, hc, hcextr‚ü© : ‚àÉ c ‚àà Ioo a b, is_local_extr (extend_from (Ioo a b) f) c :=
    by
    apply exists_local_extr_Ioo _ hab hcont
    rw [eq_lim_at_right_extend_from_Ioo hab hfb]
    exact eq_lim_at_left_extend_from_Ioo hab hfa
  use c, hc
  apply (hcextr.congr _).has_deriv_at_eq_zero (hff' c hc)
  rw [eventually_eq_iff_exists_mem]
  exact ‚ü®Ioo a b, Ioo_mem_nhds hc.1 hc.2, extend_from_extends this‚ü©
#align exists_has_deriv_at_eq_zero' exists_has_deriv_at_eq_zero'
exists_has_deriv_at_eq_zero:
/-- **Rolle's Theorem** `has_deriv_at` version -/
theorem exists_has_deriv_at_eq_zero (hab : a < b) (hfc : continuous_on f (Icc a b)) (hfI : f a = f b)
    (hff' : ‚àÄ x ‚àà Ioo a b, has_deriv_at f (f' x) x) : ‚àÉ c ‚àà Ioo a b, f' c = 0 :=
  let ‚ü®c, cmem, hc‚ü© := exists_local_extr_Ioo f hab hfc hfI
  ‚ü®c, cmem, hc.has_deriv_at_eq_zero <| hff' c cmem‚ü©
#align exists_has_deriv_at_eq_zero exists_has_deriv_at_eq_zero
exists_deriv_eq_zero':
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `expr‚Ñù -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `expr‚Ñù -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `expr‚Ñù -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within.gt -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds_within.lt -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `nhds -/
/-- **Rolle's Theorem**, a version for a function on an open interval: if `f` has the same limit
`l` at `ùìù[>] a` and `ùìù[<] b`, then `deriv f c = 0` for some `c ‚àà (a, b)`. This version
does not require differentiability of `f` because we define `deriv f c = 0` whenever `f` is not
differentiable at `c`. -/
theorem exists_deriv_eq_zero' (hab : a < b) (hfa : tendsto f (nhds_within.gt a) ((nhds) l))
    (hfb : tendsto f (nhds_within.lt b) ((nhds) l)) : ‚àÉ c ‚àà Ioo a b, deriv f c = 0 :=
  by_cases
    (fun h : ‚àÄ x ‚àà Ioo a b, differentiable_at (expr‚Ñù) f x =>
      show ‚àÉ c ‚àà Ioo a b, deriv f c = 0 from exists_has_deriv_at_eq_zero' hab hfa hfb fun x hx => (h x hx).has_deriv_at)
    fun h : ¬¨‚àÄ x ‚àà Ioo a b, differentiable_at (expr‚Ñù) f x =>
    have h : ‚àÉ x, x ‚àà Ioo a b ‚àß ¬¨differentiable_at (expr‚Ñù) f x :=
      by
      push_neg  at h
      exact h
    let ‚ü®c, hc, hcdiff‚ü© := h
    ‚ü®c, hc, deriv_zero_of_not_differentiable_at hcdiff‚ü©
#align exists_deriv_eq_zero' exists_deriv_eq_zero'
exists_deriv_eq_zero:
/-- **Rolle's Theorem** `deriv` version -/
theorem exists_deriv_eq_zero (hab : a < b) (hfc : continuous_on f (Icc a b)) (hfI : f a = f b) :
    ‚àÉ c ‚àà Ioo a b, deriv f c = 0 :=
  let ‚ü®c, cmem, hc‚ü© := exists_local_extr_Ioo f hab hfc hfI
  ‚ü®c, cmem, hc.deriv_eq_zero‚ü©
#align exists_deriv_eq_zero exists_deriv_eq_zero
exists_Ioo_extr_on_Icc:
/-- A continuous function on a closed interval with `f a = f b` takes either its maximum
or its minimum value at a point in the interior of the interval. -/
theorem exists_Ioo_extr_on_Icc (hab : a < b) (hfc : continuous_on f (Icc a b)) (hfI : f a = f b) :
    ‚àÉ c ‚àà Ioo a b, is_extr_on f (Icc a b) c :=
  by
  have ne : (Icc a b).nonempty := nonempty_Icc.2 (le_of_lt hab)
  -- Consider absolute min and max points
  obtain ‚ü®c, cmem, cle‚ü© : ‚àÉ c ‚àà Icc a b, ‚àÄ x ‚àà Icc a b, f c ‚â§ f x
  exact is_compact_Icc.exists_forall_le ne hfc
  obtain ‚ü®C, Cmem, Cge‚ü© : ‚àÉ C ‚àà Icc a b, ‚àÄ x ‚àà Icc a b, f x ‚â§ f C
  exact is_compact_Icc.exists_forall_ge ne hfc
  by_cases hc : f c = f a
  ¬∑ by_cases hC : f C = f a
    ¬∑ have : ‚àÄ x ‚àà Icc a b, f x = f a := fun x hx => le_antisymm (hC ‚ñ∏ Cge x hx) (hc ‚ñ∏ cle x hx)
      -- `f` is a constant, so we can take any point in `Ioo a b`
      rcases exists_between hab with ‚ü®c', hc'‚ü©
      refine' ‚ü®c', hc', or.inl _‚ü©
      intro x hx
      rw [mem_set_of_eq, this x hx, ‚Üê hC]
      exact Cge c' ‚ü®le_of_lt hc'.1, le_of_lt hc'.2‚ü©
    ¬∑ refine' ‚ü®C, ‚ü®lt_of_le_of_ne Cmem.1 <| mt _ hC, lt_of_le_of_ne Cmem.2 <| mt _ hC‚ü©, or.inr Cge‚ü©
      exacts[fun h => by rw [h], fun h => by rw [h, hfI]]
  ¬∑ refine' ‚ü®c, ‚ü®lt_of_le_of_ne cmem.1 <| mt _ hc, lt_of_le_of_ne cmem.2 <| mt _ hc‚ü©, or.inl cle‚ü©
    exacts[fun h => by rw [h], fun h => by rw [h, hfI]]
#align exists_Ioo_extr_on_Icc exists_Ioo_extr_on_Icc
deriv_eq_zero:
/-- **Fermat's Theorem**: the derivative of a function at a local extremum equals zero. -/
theorem is_local_extr.deriv_eq_zero (h : is_local_extr f a) : deriv f a = 0 :=
  h.elim is_local_min.deriv_eq_zero is_local_max.deriv_eq_zero
#align is_local_extr.deriv_eq_zero is_local_extr.deriv_eq_zero
card_roots_to_finset_le_derivative:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `expr‚Ñù -/
/-- The number of roots of a real polynomial is at most the number of roots of its derivative plus
one. -/
theorem card_roots_to_finset_le_derivative (p : polynomial (expr‚Ñù)) :
    p.roots.to_finset.card ‚â§ p.derivative.roots.to_finset.card + 1 :=
  p.card_roots_to_finset_le_card_roots_derivative_diff_roots_succ.trans <|
    add_le_add_right (finset.card_mono <| Finset.sdiff_subset _ _) _
#align card_roots_to_finset_le_derivative card_roots_to_finset_le_derivative
card_roots_to_finset_le_card_roots_deriv:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `expr‚Ñù -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `polynomial -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `expr‚Ñù -/
/-- The number of roots of a real polynomial `p` is at most the number of roots of its derivative
that are not roots of `p` plus one. -/
theorem card_roots_to_finset_le_card_roots_derivative_diff_roots_succ (p : polynomial (expr‚Ñù)) :
    p.roots.to_finset.card ‚â§ (p.derivative.roots.to_finset \ p.roots.to_finset).card + 1 :=
  by
  cases' eq_or_ne p.derivative 0 with hp' hp'
  ¬∑ rw [eq_C_of_derivative_eq_zero hp', roots_C, Multiset.toFinset_zero, finset.card_empty]
    exact zero_le _
  have hp : p ‚â† 0 := ne_of_apply_ne derivative (by rwa [derivative_zero])
  refine' finset.card_le_diff_of_interleaved fun x hx y hy hxy hxy' => _
